column4: :\ I'm having problems with my new ATi card ... it keeps telling me no GL support is present for a lot of things, although I've installed all the fglrx stuff I can find and the official drivers.
what sort of errors are you getting? API errors or something of that nature?
stellarium says, sdl: Couldn't set 1024x768 video mode: Couldn't find matching GLX visual!, mplayer -vo gl says [gl]  no GLX support present, tuxkart PW: Unable to open a suitable graphics window,
I might be missing some stuff too, I haven't ever had functional 3d acceleration on here ... I just got this ATi card today.
ahh, there's a wiki entry that should work for you, it did for me... one sec
It didn't work : ( fglrxinfo returns Error: couldn't find RGB GLX visual! and none of the stuff opens ; (
could you open your xorg.conf (in /etc/X11/ ) and tell me what driver it says you're using?
and is this after a restart of xorg?
okay, let me post my xorg.conf to a pastebin, and you can compare yours to mine
not too terribly far off from mine. I'm using a 9000 Mobility
they're the same with the exception of the monitor's and your touchpad, although you load module i2c and I don't.
you can always give it a try, backup backup backup :D
I have to be off, but if you want to talk with me some more if this problem persists, you can talk to me on AIM. Same name as here. :)
